Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to suggest that holding one's breath for more than 10 seconds without any discomfort or coughing can prove the absence of fibrosis in the lungs or indicate no infection.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the absence of coughing, discomfort, stuffiness, or tightness while holding one's breath for more than 10 seconds can accurately diagnose the presence or absence of the new coronavirus.
Contradict fact: The expert's verdict states that there is no evidence to support the claim that this test can determine if someone has the new coronavirus.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert's verdict provides an alternative explanation for how the new coronavirus can enter the respiratory system, contradicting the claim's emphasis on the breath-holding test.
Understate: The claim may understate the complexity and variety of symptoms associated with the new coronavirus by suggesting that the absence of specific discomfort during the breath-holding test can indicate no infection.
